attributes.action: properly read and understand e-petitions that are submitted and not simply respond quoting existing legislation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It appears that a great number of the e-petitions completed online are simply rebuffed by the Prime Minister.

Time and effort is spent by UK citizens to create the petitions and accumulate significant numbers of signatures.  It would appear that similar effort is not undertaken by The Prime Minister's office.  A large number of e-petitions are dismissed quoting existing legislation.

This seems to entirely miss the point of the petitions which in many cases is seeking to challenge that legislation.

If the Prime Minister wants to truly provide a platform for citizens to make their point then more effort is required when responding to e-petitions that have been submitted.  It is also important that a proposed plan of action is included.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
